Leaving theCountryside
Starting around 1972, universities began to recruit new students again.
Admissionswerebasednoton centralexaminations,whichwouldnotreturn
until 1977,but on “the recommendation of the masses.” Mao argued for
a system in which urban school leavers would work for several years in factories
or agriculture, before the masses selected the best among them for higher educa-
tion.After graduation, degree holders would return to factories or villages to
avoid losing their connection to the ordinary people
